website_summaries.verdict: This mess kit is a good choice if you're looking for larger pots that won't take up too much extra room.
pros: Mesh storage bag to hold the items and a carabiner to attach it to your gear
Mini-stove, silverware, bowls and cleaning sponge
Pot handles fold in and pots stack together to hold all other items inside
cons: This mess kit doesn't come with a pan, so it's not ideal for grilling

customer_reviews.title: A cooking kit with considerable thought put into it.
customer_reviews.text: It's so convenient to find kits that include just about everything you need. Not much additional searching required. This G4Free kit is well made from lightweight aluminum and includes all the necessities needed for camping. Very lightweight and packs up small. I have not had the opportunity to test this kit on a camping trip yet but an outing is planned during the next 2 weeks. If I encounter any issues with this kit I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Buckeye HD Rider

customer_reviews.title: Good budget option for weekend warriors
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by how much you get in this kit for the price. That makes it a 5 star value. No, I wouldn’t recommend taking this on a through hike of the Appalachian Trail but for weekend warriors, disaster preparedness etc. this is a great kit. If you are doing longer distance ultra light backpacking then of course opt for one of the $80 kits that will save a couple ounces and boil 30 seconds faster. As seen in my photo I could almost fit a 3.5 oz fuel canister and all the items inside the unit except the bowls. Leaving off the smallest bowl/scoop thingy I can fit them all and fuel canister in the mesh bag.
customer_reviews.author: JWillNC

customer_reviews.title: Very nice lightweight cook kit.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, works fine, tested it with my Fancy Feast can alcohol stove.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mandrell

customer_reviews.title: Scout Mom Approved
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for Boy Scouts. GREAT BUY!! He had a camp stove but the cook top had slats that were just too big for his cup/pot. We were looking around and saw this one so we said what the heck and tried it out. He has cooked 4 meals at home on it already, just for fun. simple to set up, clean, and break down. Very light weight also. This mom approves!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: which is great. I haven't actually used this yet
customer_reviews.text: ok, what they don't tell you is that your tiny stove and butane can will fit perfectly inside the smaller pot, which is great. I haven't actually used this yet, i expect the rubber on the handles to melt off almost immediately, but the rubber is really a gimmick anyway. not super thick metal, but should last the season, maybe more depending on use. for $22 thats hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Compact camp set for one
customer_reviews.text: This set has basically everything you need for one for cooking outdoors. The pot & pan are a bit on the small side, which is great if you're backpacking, but I wouldn't use this for more than one person unless you're in a pinch. The utensil design is pretty smart, they're almost full size but fold in half with a hollow wire handle to further reduce weight.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Can't see why you would want to pay more. I have an MSR pot that is stainless and I love it but I purchased this for a lightweight easy to clean smaller option. That being said you could cook quite a bit in this pot for what it is. I would definitely buy this again and I would highly recommend it if you're doing light cooking. You obviously can't use this over a campfire because aluminum cannot take high heat for extended periods of time but you can always just heat stuff up in it if you're careful which is what I do.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C

customer_reviews.title: Tiny package full of surprises!
customer_reviews.text: This camping cookware is bundle of surprise. Its look like tiny/toy but it’s really good. Material and construction of items is heavy duty. In look like it might get break but it’s really good when comes to quality. The lighter is good quality. Even spoon and knife are heavy duty stuff. One can even use in office lunchbox as it collapses to smaller version. Finally it packed in to small bag and its mobile bag, easy to carry on and reliable. Very few items of camping impress me, this is one of that.
customer_reviews.author: Sagar

customer_reviews.title: The burner worked great, the only issue I had was a bit ...
customer_reviews.text: Took this out on a 5 day backpacking trip in Southern Utah. The burner worked great, the only issue I had was a bit of water boiled over and I had to let it dry before the electric starter would work again. I had no issue with the rubber burning off the handles, I think people are turning the burner on full blast which would put out a lot of heat out and up the pot. I was able to boil water/food for 5 days quickly with no issues. Overall good quality for what you pay.
customer_reviews.author: MC87

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, terrible to clean
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this product. It has a lightweight and clever design, and the first time I used it was great. However, after making eggs in the little pan, I realised the material is not anti-stick and residues were stuck so bad to the pan (didn't burn the food) that I was not even able to clean it with strong dish soap. I ended up using spray-oven-cleaner when back home and you still can see some spots in it. I don't know if it was just my pan that's of bad quality, but I'm hesitant to cook non-liquid stuff in it again now...
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: love these things
customer_reviews.text: bought a second set for daughter after her hubby ran out of butane for the stove and put these on the fire( for those that thing cooking this way is good, dont do it, use a flat stone on the ring of fire,, has enough heat) anyhow, so I bought her a second set cuz he killed the first pans being in the fire.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer manTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: Fire Hazard
customer_reviews.text: The handle of this product caught fire in less than 5 seconds of being placed on a standard gas camping stove. Bit of a flaw for a piece of cooking equipment to be so highly flammable. Not safe. Unless you want to be on your local news for starting the latest forest fire, I would go with a different product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Allen

customer_reviews.title: 10 Day Camping Survival Kit
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size for one person camping in the great outdoors. The wooden spoon is a little short so make sure when you're stirring boiling water or whatever you're cooking in the pot that you hold the wooden spoon by the very tip to prevent from burning your hand. I also really liked that everything fit in a very small compact bag - the way that the bowls fold into each other is a real space saver and great to have when trying to save space for other things in your camping pack!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Spirit Burner
customer_reviews.text: Comes with a mesh bag but it is a tight fit (maybe good but takes a few seconds to pull it out and put it away). There is a little bit of room in the inner most pot for extra storage area. I keep a couple of paper towels, a spirit burner, small bottle of alcohol, stove stand, and a box of matches in there. Next time I go out, I might only bring the inner two pots and leave the outer one at home.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for camping
customer_reviews.text: Nice, compact set of pots to carry with camping. Only word of caution is not to use high heat on them as the food has a tendency to burn in them and then stick on, but they were easily cleaned with some soap and water. Definitely recommend them as long as you're not looking for something with the size/diameter of a saute pan.
customer_reviews.author: silverado98_nighthawk84

customer_reviews.title: Very Light Product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this cookware for a backpacking trip on the AT trail. Light travel is really important when traveling for days. This set is very light, cleans well and all the pieces fit very well. You can not beat the price. My son has also used it on a camping trip. they cook many meals with it. I believe if you take care of this cookware it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Just what I’ve been searching for.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve borrowed cool sets for a few years and always wanted something simple compact and not expensive. This fits all those boxes. I tried it right away and was shocked that it boiled water faster then a jetboil. I like the compact kit which can go in the backpack or just clip to the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Beil

customer_reviews.title: Great if you need something small and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: So far these have only been used for one camping trip. But, we are just starting to do motorcycle camping trips and needed something small that doesn't take up much room on saddle bags. These were the right price and SO much easier to clean than my ancient aluminum camping pots. Great to cook simple meals for 2 people. I would want something a bit more hardy for car camping where size and weight are less of an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Great for 1 Person
customer_reviews.text: I love that it has all that I need. Inside it comes with a stove top, wooden mixing spoon, cleaning sponge, utensils (knife/fork/spoon), three small plastic bowls, and a plastic dipping cup. For $25 a perfect little kit for camping. I'm putting this is my 72 hour kit and will use it for personal camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: Anadine Marshall

customer_reviews.title: ensuring marital bliss
customer_reviews.text: Not too heavy. Easily split. Nesting. Perfect. I put the big ones in my pack and the little 'uns in my wife's pack. We each had a stove and pots should we get separated. Although we've been married for almost sixteen years, so I don't really thing separation is a real issue. Sure, we have our tiffs and rows every now and again; but who doesn't. It's just good to know, reassuring, if you will, that if we do split - and happen to be in the woods, she can still boil water and sticks. That's right, I'll let her carry a lousy pot, but I'm keeping the dang food.
customer_reviews.author: FANLig

customer_reviews.title: Great price but lower quality for me. Good for two people. Pots don't lock together.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like this item. Pots didn't lock into each other. Coating is not to my liking. The handles are nice and are well insulated. Is just not my cup o tea. It's a great option if you are coming for two but I just didn't care for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Cranjis McBasketball

customer_reviews.title: Good quality cup a d bowel set
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for single person with room inside to nest additional items like alcohol stove, fuel, matches, etc. Comes in mesh bag which is necessary to keep it all together. Pack able. Update: Have used it about 4 times now and also about 6 times at home. It is easy to use, light weight, anodized coating so one should use plastic heat resistant utensils to avoid scratches. Have not used the set on campuses only alcohol stove and on regular stove at home. Was able to take long term heat to cook a small pot of been and ham and make rice and cook eggs. All went fine.
customer_reviews.author: James A.

customer_reviews.title: Great little set
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy set of cookware, and rivals the GSI brand for the same size. However I recommend just removing the green rubber grips from the pots. These pots are small, camp stove burners are wider and the green grips melted into char at the first use. I wish we'd removed those initially rather than scrape off a mess. Otherwise, great item. Just use a regular hot pad to pick up the metal handles and you're good. Easy to clean and tidy nesting set up for camping.
customer_reviews.author: DMM

customer_reviews.title: What I expected
customer_reviews.text: It came a couple days late, but wasn't in a rush since I'm not planning on using it till backpacking season in a couple months. I'm only planning on using the smaller set inside when I'm packing alone. My gigs stove fits nicely inside with a canister of fuel. Going to cut a sponge and put it inside as well to keep the stove from moving around, maybe a lighter and matches if there is enough space. Looked exactly like I thought and for the you can't really beat them. I'll update to say how long they last when I have used them a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: perfect for pocket rocket
customer_reviews.text: Fry pan works great with my pocket rocket. Not sure if will use the small bowls, but will use the pot at later date. Photos made me believe the green was sillicone, but its hard plastic. Overall a good product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee L.

customer_reviews.title: Light weight xook kit
customer_reviews.text: I took this cook set for an outing and was able to prepare enough food for two people. Everything worked great. Used the burner and it worked great no issues. Most definitely used the wooden rice paddle if you use metal can damage the nonstick. Clean up was a breeze. Small plastic bowl are 8 oz. The fork locking slide plate was loose but quick fix with my leatherman. Highly recommend for a day trip or a weekend trip.
customer_reviews.author: William Garcia Jr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 2 campers!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite thing about these pots is that they store so well. The handles fold in and out easily and it comes with a small mesh bag for storage. We put the pot above a fire pit one night at the plastic on the handles got a little burnet, but they still work great!
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: Too small for anything
customer_reviews.text: These are so much smaller than I thought. The smaller of the two couldn’t even hold enough water for a cup of tea! Definitely not worth the money, maybe half the price since only one is usable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good quality, will def bring them next year camping
customer_reviews.text: good quality, will def bring them next year camping. however, i did expect them to be a little bigger. that may have been my own fault though ( i feel like the picture made them look slightly bigger) Their customer service is great. They sent me an email regarding my unhappiness with the size and offered a resolution. Thus i increased their rating
customer_reviews.author: ingrid

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Took this pot/pan set camping with my fiance and myself to upstate NewYork a few weeks ago. Does its job boiling water/heating food. Cannot complain there. Only complaint is that the green handle coating melts really easy over an open flame. I suppose thats my fault for using it over a campfire grate and not exclusively over my backpacking stove. If you have some type of heat resistant glove as a backup, or your shirt sleeve ;) , then this product should serve you a real long time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: I've had these pots for about 2 years. I've ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had these pots for about 2 years. I've cooked dozens of meals in them. My only issue with them is that they don't have markings for the volume, but it's not a very big deal. I've probably backpacked ~100 miles with these and canoed 50 miles. They're portable and can fit a fuel can and small stove in them.
customer_reviews.author: Blake T.

customer_reviews.title: Pleased With My Pots
customer_reviews.text: Just tested it by cooking up the powdered equivalent of eight eggs. Tasty, fluffy and filling. Eggs cooked evenly and, while not as easy to clean up as my seasoned cast iron skillet (nothing is), it cleans up quickly and weighs a lot less. Going to take it on a short backpacking trip soon. Suggestion: Buy a small plastic whisk for mixing powered eggs and freeze dried meals. More effective than just a wooden spoon and won't scratch the non-stick finish.
customer_reviews.author: Herr Schenk

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Update review: all i have to say is wow. These pots are incredible for the price. I recently went to colorado to hike and bought these pots to use while camping. The main thing i noticed was that food didnt stick. Just add a little water after your done eating and food just came right off the pot. Storage is fine, they are a bit bulky but the cool thing is that you can fit your portable mini stove, lighter, matches and a few other things inside when transporting them. Overall, im very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan garcia

customer_reviews.title: Design is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Awesome design. I just got this today and was stoked to find out an 8 oz msr isopro tank, an etekcity mini camping stove, and the cleaning sponge the cooking gear came with. This is a significant space saver and prevents me from having to buy another bag to put them all in. Now I just need to find a place to put my spork:)
customer_reviews.author: Desert Ranger Tycho

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Dime!
customer_reviews.text: Holy campgear, Batman! Great set! Used it for our weeklong family camping trip and they are sturdy little guys! They heat up fast, clean fast, and stack up nice and neat. I have sang praises to fellow adventurers. I was even able to CAREFULLY use over a campfire.
customer_reviews.author: Elea

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Advertising. Capacity Not As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: When the pots are filled to their very brims they can only hold, 1.4, 1.05, .65, .5 litres respectively. Not the claimed 1.6, 1.2, .8 .6 litres. This means the pots can only boil/cook 1 and .8 litres. Which is much smaller than expected. The pots arrived scratched and chipped.around the rims as they are packed without foam or cardboard cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: mark s.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: I received this cookware set promptly, and everything was as described. I got the 13 piece set, and even some of the pieces (stirring stick, scrubbing thing, etc) were unnecessary but appreciated. Once I purchased a gas can (~$4) separately, the stand was easy to screw on, and the auto-igniting spark was a nice touch. I love how compact everything sits when in the drawstring (good material btw) and is easily portable. Would reccommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ori Lindner

customer_reviews.title: Light and just the right size
customer_reviews.text: Weighs 8.25 oz, perfectly holds a gas can, burner, and folding utensils. Handles function well and are sturdy. Graduated volume markings are a definite plus.
customer_reviews.author: PrettyPetra

customer_reviews.title: so I would recommend finding a cookware temperature plastic Spork or plastic spoon ...
customer_reviews.text: It's anodized metal, so I would recommend finding a cookware temperature plastic Spork or plastic spoon for it. Metal would probably scratch it all up. However, for the price, it's excellent! I put my fuel stove, wooden spoon and spoon inside. All fits (in the larger set with the 750ml measurement, think it's probably 800ml in total?)
customer_reviews.author: Dark Trainer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: I love this!! It’s lightweight, portable, and compact. This is a perfect starter kit for anyone getting into backpacking. I would say it’s very comparable to things sold at REI for quadruple the price.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Fun little camping set
customer_reviews.text: Very compact and light weight. I cooked only hot dogs , oatmeal, and coffee and there is a little mark that cant be removed. Keep the cooking simple and watch your flame.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it
customer_reviews.text: A friend was lamenting food permanently burnt into the bottom of his $100+ Jet Boil. Meanwhile, I'm happy as a clam alongside him with my $20 kit. Substitute the utensils for a $3 Walmart plastic spoon/fork combo (not a spork, believe it or not) for a scratch-proof stirring solution. Buy a gas can. What more do you want?
customer_reviews.author: Josiah N.

customer_reviews.title: Handles melted and got hot on first use
customer_reviews.text: I used these pans one time on a small camping stove like their purpose intends. The very first use the plastic handles literally began melting off. They also got very hot so I could not grip the handles to take the pan off the stove with my bare hands as I should have been able to. I tried adjusting the pans placent but it did not help the handles continued to melt though they were nowhere near any kind of flame. I am dissapointed as I just wanted some nice stackable pots for camping and now I will have to keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but maybe top-heavy
customer_reviews.text: This set works really well! The only problem is that you can't see the sides of the isopro cooking stand when you set the pot on it, so it's hard to center the pot. The pot is big, so it seems top-heavy and I'm worried that it could fall over. I'll purchase an isopro canister stand for next time.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob L.

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.text: The rubber handles melted the first use. They have an awful smell that no amount of soap and boiling water can get rid of. They are nice and light and it comes with a nice carrying bag. Other than that is it cheap Asian import junk.
customer_reviews.author: JBrookie

customer_reviews.title: Great kit for ADV camping.
customer_reviews.text: Well designed set. Everything nests to make a very small storage space requirement. Perfect for ADV motorcycle camping.
customer_reviews.author: BmanTN

customer_reviews.title: Solid camp kit for the money
customer_reviews.text: Amazing kit for the money. Includes a nice stove and everything you need for far less money than other kits. I trimmed mine down to the pot, stove, lid and ladle and it is less than a pound. Do it! 13pc set as there are different options
customer_reviews.author: andrew Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for some soup, heating up small quantities of water and a quick boil. Handles never got hot even over an open flame.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis G

customer_reviews.title: G4Free Outdoor Camping Backpacking Bowl, Pot ,Pan, burner set
customer_reviews.text: I've taken this and used it on many backpacking trips. I like the size of the cup and bowl and the net case it comes with. The burner folds up nicely in it's own case too. The only thing that would make it perfect is if it had a built in lighter. Still performs great and liked the price!
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Light, functional, practical, reasonable!
customer_reviews.text: Sweet little pot/pan set. Not real big or long lasting, but they will definitely do the job for many camping seasons. They are so reasonably priced, just use them until they're trashed, then buy a new set. I have an avid camping buddy who has had his set for 8-years and they still look and work great.
customer_reviews.author: denny48

customer_reviews.title: Not a 4 piece set, actually a 2 piece st
customer_reviews.text: Not a 4 piece set, doesn't include knife or spoon. Mine had clearly opened and returned before I got it. Not pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mh1023

customer_reviews.title: Good for Camping
customer_reviews.text: This was a good addition to our camping gear. It’s light weight, easy to clean and it does not take up a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: Jsdavidson0407

customer_reviews.title: Great option for compact cookware
customer_reviews.text: I used these on a recent backpacking trip. They were the only cookware we used or needed (there were two of us and these were plenty big). They pack compactly and the two larger pans can be covered with the two smaller pans to retain heat or keep out bugs (the covers seat firmly in place). The volume graduations on the sides are helpful for measuring water to add to dehydrated meals, coffee, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk A. Campana

customer_reviews.title: The perfect and portable cooking set for the field
customer_reviews.text: The perfect and portable cooking set for the field. I take some beef and chicken broths with me to the field and use the little bowls as a cup. Perfect field comfort. When you pack everything into the pots, it really doesn't take up much room in your sack and the whole thing is nice and light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice but ridiculously small
customer_reviews.text: This product is nice enough if you are cooking soup and coffee only. The size is ridiculously small. Other than heating coffee, tea or soup I can't begin to imagine what this would be enough for? My soup thermos lid/bowl is larger than the largest "pot" in this ensemble.
customer_reviews.author: M. Barry

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Liked very much. Only thing that would be better is something to hold them together besides the bag. Other then that it is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Wimbley

customer_reviews.title: Nice but not very durable.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little kit but I don’t know how well it will last. Only time will tell....
customer_reviews.author: Hiking with Epilepsy

customer_reviews.title: An excellent item for the price and it's intended use
customer_reviews.text: An excellent item for the price and it's intended use, which is to place in my truck box along with a couple canisters of gas and a small camping stove to use with this set. Just as an emergency that a person never sees coming until it's there. The shipping was fast and it arrived in excellent shape. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Bryon Beaulieu

customer_reviews.title: Netted bag that it comes with is key to keeping the set nicely stacked together
customer_reviews.text: Used the set on an overnight hike. Had no problems balancing on my Etekcity portable burner. Had no problems with the handles getting too hot or melting. Only "issue" I would say is it has no lid that comes with it to trap steam while boiling water. I carried an extra silicone top for this purpose. Stove and tank fit inside for storage while hiking. Netted bag that it comes with is key to keeping the set nicely stacked together.
customer_reviews.author: AL_KO

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This product is excellent quality for the price. It was easy to clean and store.
customer_reviews.author: schmackdaddy

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Great for backpacking. light weight and durable. The coating seems durable and the handles are fastened well. On a recent backpacking trip these pans boiled water for dehydrated foods quickly and evenly, Watch the handles, if the coating gets near direct flame it will scorch and melt. Mine show a little evidence of getting to hot but not a big deal, honestly. I would recommend these pans to any hiker or backpacker looking for a decent inexpensive set of pans.
customer_reviews.author: Shredingmetal

customer_reviews.title: Enough for two people.
customer_reviews.text: Nice collection. Two of shared on a recent backcountry backpacking trip. Worked great. Handles were sturdy, kit was compact. We were able to fit accessories (coffee filter, fold-up spork, suds bottle, dishrag) inside as well. We could have even left one of the pots at home.
customer_reviews.author: jbh

customer_reviews.title: Great cookware.
customer_reviews.text: Careful not to get the flame too high or it will melt the rubber coating on the handles. Even if that happens, it doesn't affect the functionality of the pots. It only messes with my OCD.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooking Set for Camping
customer_reviews.text: This set is great just a little smaller then I thought. Come with cute carrying bag.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa E. Whitley-Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Nice cookware for camping
customer_reviews.text: Used on a weekend camping trip, cooked up every thing we needed and cleaned up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a 3 day trip and cooked multiple times each day. Worth the money and such a better value rather than paying for the high dollar box store gear.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan McNeely

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Perfect sizes, and good packing. I will leave the plastic junk at home and put the fuel inside when packing, but the fork and spoon are pretty cool. The stove is TEEEEEEENY. I was expecting a LITTLE bit bigger, but, it works
customer_reviews.author: Cheri C.

customer_reviews.title: Tiny bowls
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware, the bowl size is way too small compared what seems in the pictures here. The pictures in item description give a misleading impression for size of the bowls. I am not sure what would you cook in these tiny bowls for camping in state or national parks in America.
customer_reviews.author: JITENDRA VYAS

customer_reviews.title: I really like how they nestle together
customer_reviews.text: I really like how they nestle together. I keep paper towels (for clean up), a lighter, and a small ultralight mini burner from etekcity inside them. We heat water and then pour the contents of our backpackers pantry meal in, rehydrate and enjoy. Excellent for family backpacking trips.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for camping but think it might be better for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: I knew this was going to be small. I bought it for camping thinking it would be enough, which it may, but I would recommend this for someone that is going backpacking. Its cute though. Super light weight. I have not had a chance to use it yet. I am curious how long it will last with careful hands. Excited to break it in though. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jaimie

customer_reviews.title: Great kit, awesome value
customer_reviews.text: Great kit, especially for the price. The fact that it includes such a small stove is awesome since I’m using it for backpacking. The stove worked great, as did the pots. I took out the plastic cup/bowls since I didn’t really need them. Really like the utensils also, only issue is the locks on them down work great and sometimes the fork folds as you’re using it. Not a big deal if you just pay attention to how you hold it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Cox

customer_reviews.title: More than 2 pots. Butane tank storage too.
customer_reviews.text: It worked perfectly. I didn't realize that I could store my butane tank and burner inside when both pots are put together for storage. That's a bonus!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve R

customer_reviews.title: Lots of options, pretty light, well made
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to pack and gives a lot of options for cooking and heating water for more than just one person. Probably too heavy for a serious long trek backpacker, but works well enough to pack in a mile or two. Fits together really efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Burns

customer_reviews.title: Useable; but not durable for long use.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight. Not good for long term use. For the price, it might be worth using and throwing away after your camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: August M Whipple

customer_reviews.title: The item that I recieved was the pictured item. ...
customer_reviews.text: The item that I recieved was the pictured item. The pans are compact when put together and the mesh it comes in keeps them in place well. The only problem I had with the set was that one of the handles on the pans seemed a bit loose and came off but its not something that I can't t fix myself by tightening them. Thanks for the quick delivery. Can't wait to use them when out camping. =)
customer_reviews.author: Hector G. Romero

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the expense
customer_reviews.text: They are incredibly small and realistically for someone camping by themselves. Additionally the quality is crap and the handles melted upon first use.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Okayest burner
customer_reviews.text: The product was pretty ok. The burner works great, but the little pot doesn’t sit stable on it. I had to hold it the whole time. The little bowls just take up space and aren’t worth much. The wooden spoon came molded like it had been wet. All in all, the actual burner is fine. I could have done without the rest of the added pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but for the price they are decent quality and perfect size and weight for backpacking for 2 people
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used them yet, but for the price they are decent quality and perfect size and weight for backpacking for 2 people. The shallower pans can be used as lids on the larger pots and they nestle nicely together, fitting perfectly in the included mesh bag. There is plenty of room to stow your portable stove, spices, etc inside. The handles can come off, as they are not attached at the hinge with a complete piece of metal, but it shouldn't be a problem if they are not mishandled.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: I love it. It gives you four pots
customer_reviews.text: This arrived in the mail just in time for the camping trip i bought it for. I love it. It gives you four pots, or pots can be used for lids. My camp fuel and stove sit right inside, and although its not totally nonstick even with butter, it comes clean easy just soaking it in water inside the pot. I then cleaned it with just a rubber spatula and napkin instead of a scrubby sponge, you dont need to or want to scratch the insides. This is really all i need, I cooked eggs, soup, quinoa, teawater, and even had an extra pot to leave leftovers to reheat later. Nice price for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Alice2

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than exoected
customer_reviews.text: A lot smaller than I expected. I got these for camping, but we didn't actually use them. I guess they would come in handy if you needed to boil some water or something.
customer_reviews.author: Vinegar Strokes

customer_reviews.title: Very good quility.
customer_reviews.text: I have not used them in the field but they are of good quality and expect them to last for long time if taken care of properly. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: RjVZ

customer_reviews.title: Great value for use as a starter kit for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Great value for use as a starter kit for my son and I to take camping. We purchased this 4-piece kit since it was only slightly more expensive than other 2-piece kits. We used this with an Etekcity Ultralight Portable Outdoor Backpacking Camping Stove ($10), a can of fuel and a fuel stand (total, $10 from REI) and were able to cook 3 meals a day with no issues. Our Fuel Can, Stand, and stove all fit inside the pots and total weight was very reasonable for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Everson

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased thus far
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased thus far. I have a smaller set for solo backpacking by a large brand name that was quite pricey compared to this. This is perfect for car camping trips when I take more people. Lightweight too. It's big for backpacking but if you were splitting your load with someone else it would be great. My compact stove fits right inside too!
customer_reviews.author: RCL

customer_reviews.title: Grate camp kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Handy for light backpacking. My entire kitchen including fuel canister fit inside.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Day

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping
customer_reviews.text: Very efficient for camping. The small pot is great for hot beverages!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Sue Teach

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after reading the reviews at outdoorgearlab. Package showed no damage when received. Opened package and larger pot had a big dent in the bottom edge, and the coating was damaged and the aluminum was exposed. Product was fulfilled by amazon, so I returned it. The next day I received an email from the company and they went the extra mile. Within 2 days I had a new replacement set of pots. I have tested both pots and they are right on par with the review noted above. This is an excellent lightweight set for 2 people. You can boil 7 cups of water between the 2 pots, this should be more than enough for food and drink.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Bought for camping. They’re nice but watch the handles over fire as they can melt.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: I just love these!!
customer_reviews.text: I just love these!! Lightweight, functional, and durable! I've taken these backpacking and camping. Watch out for the green plastic on the handles, though. They will melt if you use these pots over campfire. These should be mainly used for camp stoves only. In any case, if the green plastic on the handles melt they can be easily peeled off of the handles.
customer_reviews.author: Iya

customer_reviews.title: 13 $ for this really good price
customer_reviews.text: I love camping and my backpack is always heavy so this little pot is really good for this
customer_reviews.author: Tsotne pavliashvili

customer_reviews.title: ... is very compact and came with a mesh - perfect for both car and backpack camping
customer_reviews.text: it is very compact and came with a mesh - perfect for both car and backpack camping ..but the small one already had a little scratch on the outside and this tag was another story - see the picture lol
customer_reviews.author: Petra Holt

customer_reviews.title: Compact.  Has the basic needs for backpacking. One issue.
customer_reviews.text: overall the product looked okay, however upon further inspection before even using it I found that one of the stabilizing arms would not stay in the horizontal position because the bent tab that is supposed to hold it up was on the wrong side or the arm was riveted upside down.
customer_reviews.author: Q Family

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the wrong type of propane bottle for our ike so we had to heat these with water over a campfire. Surprisingly they stood up to the challenge very well. The rubber grips melted slightly but they worked for a whole week without trouble. They are very light weight and cool off quickly which is awesome when hiking. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Serina

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set. They are a great value. I use daily when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Vertigo

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful set!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for backpacking with Boy Scouts. My son took two pieces,and I took the other two. They were perfect. I liked that the handles are coated so that you can handle the pots when hot. The pots were big enough to put my stove in side, making for easy packing.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Handles Melted
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed with this purchase. The pots themselves worked great but when we used them on our coleman stove top while we were camping, the green handles caught on fire and started melting! We were surprised that they did this, as that is what they are meant for. Otherwise good product.
customer_reviews.author: Hailey

customer_reviews.title: Four Year Update - Great :)
customer_reviews.text: I’ve put these pots through heck and back the past 4 years of owning them. Cooking in hot ashes and coals over fires, hours and hours over alcohol stoves, etc. They’ve never failed me! I do recommend only bringing the two bigger pots for backpacking. You dont need all four! Save the weight. :)
customer_reviews.author: So.g.

customer_reviews.title: Great backpacking set
customer_reviews.text: Great backpacking set, everything packs away into a very small form factor. Even includes a cleaning loufa for ease of use. Haven't tried out the burner yet but am looking forward to it.
customer_reviews.author: Sullydoc101

customer_reviews.title: Great cook set for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great cook set for the money. Used it over a portable wood oven many times with 0 issues. All the accessories it comes with are garbage though just replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Stahl

customer_reviews.title: Very small and good for only 1 person
customer_reviews.text: Really small-only for 1 person meals. Originally bought for RV stove and it's still too small. I was going to return but my return date had passed and now they are going into my hurricane emergency supply stash : /
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great pot set, nest inside each other, has it's own carry bag, very light. Handles fold in to the sides. I love this set
customer_reviews.author: hotnakedbigfoot

product_meta.title: G4Free Camping Cookware Mess Kit 4/11/13/16 Piece Hiking Backpacking Picnic Cooking Bowl Non Stick Pot Pan Knife Spoon Set
feature_bullets: If you want a cookware set that has the teapot/kettle, pls refer to B07HG35438 or B07HG33CQZ. Extra bonus.
HIGHEST QUALITY/EASY CLEAN - Non-Toxic anodized aluminum pot and frying pan, easy to clean.

BEST PRICE/SAVE MONEY - Package 13 pieces includes non-stick pan x 1 and pot x 1, wooden spatula x 1, mini stove x 1, stainless steel foldable knife x 1/ fork x 1/spoon x 1, bowls x 3 and spoon x 1 set, carabiner x 1, loofah spongex 1
Easy Packing & Taking: All the objects in this cooking set can be stored together in a mesh bag for space saving and convenient carry.

PERFECT COOKWARE FOR YOURSELF/ FAMILY- It is suitable for camping, hiking, backpacking, picnic and other outdoor activities. Lightweight and extremely durable anodized aluminum. Perfect for camping backpacking
100% GUARANTEE-Your purchase will be backed by a 100% money-back guarantee. If there are any product quality problems, please feel free to contact us for help.
